reviews.text: Awesome place to visit! What a beautiful structure man has ever built. Simply marvellous! This building is stunning and looks even more gorgeous in the evening or night. Laser guided show make this building one of its kind. Evening or night is the best time to visit.

Iconic and  beautiful, luxurious hotel. The infinity pool is amazing and the views from the top are very nice, especially at night. Nice, clean rooms with an amazing view (I was on the 37th floor, facing the city). Breakfast buffet is really excellent and there are some very nice restaurants inside the hotel. Walking distance to the Gardens by the bay and the centre. Highly recommended!

Love the place. Relatively less crowded  compared to other shopping centres. There are only one halal restaurant in this area. The Science Art Museum is nearby. Casinos are just around the corner. Great laser light shows at night.

One of the most iconic hotel and business complex in Singapore. The place is upscale and exuberant with high end brands, a theater on the river front, an observatory deck on top, and some offices as well. The restaurants serve appetizing gourmet food with a wide variety of dishes. You can get a panoramic view of the city and the beautiful skyline across the bay. Also you can spot the F1 circuit around the Singapore flyer from the observatory deck.

Highly recommend a stay at marina bay sands. Stunning swimming infinity pool across the top of the building with great views. Close to all amenities such as casino which is pretty amazing and shopping galore. It was definitely difficult navigating your way through the 3 towers although very impressive indeed. The only letdown was my friend had left his watch behind in his room on check out when he went back it was gone! Management were not very helpful at all.

001c087f1868d6f4297b43f6f78616d1c9f.amenities: Connecting Rooms;Gift Shop;Free Wi-Fi;Wheelchair Accessible;Spa;Gym;Club Lounge;Laundry & Dry Cleaning;
001c087f1868d6f4297b43f6f78616d1c9f.body: 55 floors of luxurious hotel rooms and suites, spread across three towers: that’s Marina Bay Sands®, an integrated resort that also houses a four-storey casino and the ArtScience Museum™. Choice views of the city skyline, harbour or Gardens by the Bay await – along with a personal butler service for higher tier rooms. Be sure to take a dip in the iconic 150-metre-long infinity pool, the integrated resort’s crowning glory nestled within Sands SkyPark.
001c087f1868d6f4297b43f6f78616d1c9f.description: Besides its hotel arm, Marina Bay Sands® is an integrated resort that houses high-end retailers and restaurants, a four-storey casino and the ArtScience Museum.
001c087f1868d6f4297b43f6f78616d1c9f.name: Marina Bay Sands® hotel

001d8abc429fafd4c2d94d7fbbf90b11174.body: The Fullerton Bay Hotel Singapore is a stunning, jewel-like addition to the sparkling Marina Bay waterfront, with breath-taking architecture and stunning interiors that combine modernity and heritage. Seated on prime waterfront location in the Central Business District and arts and cultural precinct, the 5-star accommodation offers classic luxurious hospitality and exquisite service with rooms featuring 360 degree spectacular views of the Marina Bay and Singapore skyline.

reviews.text: Location is great! I really liked how it's right by the Marina Bay area, so the view is superb and very photogenic for a Singaporean hotel. It's also very accessible, being right by Raffles Place station. Lantern is great as a rooftop bar, especially at night where it's less humid and warm. Highly recommend a good date night at this place!

Fullerton is the hotel you go if you want to look out and see Singapore's best. Shenton Way on one side, Marina Bay on the next, the best of everything comes together here. Prices are a bit high but of course, the location is the gem here.
Great hotel. Previously the Post Office, now, it is one of the best hotels you can be in Singapore. Always have so much fun with the family when we are here.

A beautiful hotel set in a beautiful area of Singapore on the bay. We had a corner room which was large and furnished to a high standard. The bathroom was large and well equipped with a bath and large shower and basin with lots of room for bits. The room was also equipped with a Samsung tablet providing hotel information plus a mobile phone for guest use in and out of the hotel. This hotel is popular for events and as such can cause a few problems if you wish to eat in the hotel as the restaurants can often be booked for these. On the occasion this happened to us the duty manager resolved the problem  by allowing  the brasserie menu to be served to us in the Clifford restaurant which  was a good gesture.
Visit the roof pool and enjoy good food, & drink really nice and helpful staff whilst relaxing under the sun.  Would l stay again, yes please and longer

The Fullerton Hotel is a refurbished building that was formerly called Collier Quay. It was a landing area for passenger boats going to the neighbouring Indonesian islands and junk boats ferrying goods to the bigger ships anchored offshore in the 1960/70s. Now it’s a beautiful hotel. Even if you are not a guest, it’s a beautiful place to come relax, enjoy and be near the ocean.

001d8abc429fafd4c2d94d7fbbf90b11174.description: The Fullerton Bay Hotel Singapore is a stunning, jewel-like addition to the sparkling Marina Bay waterfront, with breath-taking architecture and stunning interiors that combine modernity and heritage.
001d8abc429fafd4c2d94d7fbbf90b11174.name: The Fullerton Bay Hotel Singapore

00540bbe0cb27a94698ab2bdbce59a0c91c.body: Suki-Ya truly brings the popular ‘House of Hot Pot’ concept to life, offering a heart-warming dining experience at an affordable price. Its signature Shabu-shabu dish is a must-try, and goes extremely well with the quality meats served. Other popular soup choices include Sukiyaki and Touyu Miso broth. Hungry diners will truly enjoy the Sukiya experience, as they can order unlimited servings of delicious sliced beef, pork, and chicken. To top it all off, a salad bar featuring a wide selection of fresh vegetables is offered, bring balance to the whole meal.
00540bbe0cb27a94698ab2bdbce59a0c91c.description: Suki-Ya truly brings the popular ‘House of Hot Pot’ concept to life, offering a heart-warming dining experience at an affordable price. Its signature Shabu-shabu dish is a must-try, and goes extremely well with the quality meats served. Other popular soup choices include Sukiyaki and Touyu Miso broth. Hungry diners will truly enjoy the Sukiya experience, as they can order unlimited servings of delicious sliced beef, pork, and chicken. To top it all off, a salad bar featuring a wide selection of fresh vegetables is offered, bring balance to the whole meal.
00540bbe0cb27a94698ab2bdbce59a0c91c.name: Suki-Ya (Marina Square)

0053581301b603949ae9b105ad98b0dac83.body: Marina Bay Sands’® Celebrity Chef Restaurants

reviews.text:
Lovely restaurant with nice ambiance.
The staff were very efficient and friendly. Glass would always filled up.
Had their 3 course lunch set. The appetiser, main course and dessert were all very delicious. At only $19, it is really worth it and I would probably come back to have their lunch set again when the dishes change.

Strongly recommend the power lunch menu where it changes every 2 week. I give it a 3-star as the menu didn’t state that you cannot have more than 6 if you want to order the power menu. Very disappointed with such restriction especially we went in group of 8. A must-try is their signature impossible burger. It really tastes like a burger when it is a vegan meal. I have to go back again try this since I was the one who can’t order the power menu when I visited yesterday

Good ambiance,

The staffs are nice, good services. 
Too bad I was in a rush otherwise I would  dine there.
Tried several cocktails. Was really good and professional.

Restaurant with very nice ambience, the staffs are very attentive to requests so great service. Most of all, we enjoyed the food, especially the sea barramundi which was perfectly pan seared. Thumbs up folks!

Very good restaurant in the Marina Bay Sands hotel. I had a degustation menu with drinks pairing. For the first time in my life not only wine but also cocktails were paired with the food courses. Very interesting idea. I must say it is a bit dangerous because you will get drunk more easily. Still a very good experience.

0053581301b603949ae9b105ad98b0dac83.description: An epicurean treat awaits at Marina Bay Sands®, with its host of ten restaurants helmed by some of the world’s finest celebrity chefs. Notable mentions include the Michelin-starred CUT by Wolfgang Puck and Waku Ghin by Tetsuya Wakuda. Don’t miss Social Hour on Tuesdays, when signature cocktails at select restaurants and bars go for half price.
0053581301b603949ae9b105ad98b0dac83.name: Marina Bay Sands’® Celebrity Chef Restaurants

002a031ff1aa6b9471e8327b48fb5e2014a.description: The Marina Bay Sands integrated resort comprises convention and exhibition facilities, 2,561­ hotel rooms and suites, a casino spanning four floors, and the Sands Theatre that features Broadway and West End musicals, amongst others. Sitting 57 floors aboveground is the Sands SkyPark with its iconic 150-metre-long infinity pool. Alongside are restaurants, bars, nightclubs and an observation deck from which to take in sweeping, 360-degree views of the city. The resort’s luxury mall, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, features an extensive selection of designer boutiques, celebrity chef restaurants and dining options. The integrated resort is also home to the lotus-shaped ArtScience Museum – the first of its kind in the world – and Spectra, a kaleidoscopic outdoor light and water show that takes place nightly over the waters fronting the Event Plaza.
002a031ff1aa6b9471e8327b48fb5e2014a.name: Marina Bay Sands

002b8fc0ca8705a45a1ac4bf67ff5b6a9bd.body:
Located at the tip of our Club's breakwater is Raffles Marina's own lighthouse. Built in 1994 and overlooking the Tuas Second Link - Singapore's second causeway to Malaysia, this 12 metres high icon flashes every 10 seconds with a beam that reaches 15 metres. The lighthouse is maintained by the Club and is the only lighthouse not owned and operated by the Maritime Port Authority of Singapore.

The beacon is also a popular spot for cycling communities, leisure photography groups and bloggers. Some of these photographs have been featured on sites such as Pinterest, Flickr and on Instagram via this hashtag, #rafflesmarinalighthouse.

The lighthouse, together with the marina, has been featured on wedding and lifestyle websites and blogs, Raffles Marina has been described as one of the most ideal and unique venues among couples for wedding photography and nautical themed weddings.

During the evenings, soak in the expanse of the beautiful sunset right at the sea as you take a stroll down the pier to the lighthouse. No wonder this icon is known to many as one of the most picturesque in Singapore!

Visit Raffles Marina Lighthouse, opens daily from 7am to 12am.
002b8fc0ca8705a45a1ac4bf67ff5b6a9bd.admissionInfo: Free admission. Simply identify and register yourself at the security post before entering the club premise.
002b8fc0ca8705a45a1ac4bf67ff5b6a9bd.description: Located at the tip of our Club's breakwater is Raffles Marina's own lighthouse. Built in 1994 and overlooking the Tuas Second Link - Singapore's second causeway to Malaysia, this 12 metres high icon flashes every 10 seconds with a beam that reaches 15 metres. The lighthouse is maintained by the Club and is the only lighthouse not owned and operated by the Maritime Port Authority of Singapore.
002b8fc0ca8705a45a1ac4bf67ff5b6a9bd.name: Raffles Marina Lighthouse

0025ad97272bb114d13af613e357b7a451e.body: Whether a Broadway hit or West End offering, the Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands® brings the best shows under one roof for a world-class experience – think The Lion King, WICKED and MAMMA MIA!. The venue sits 2,155 across three levels, complete with plush seats and high-quality audio and visual equipment. Complement your experience with one of the integrated resort’s show packages for a sumptuous meal or hotel stay after.

reviews.text: Amazing auditorium. The stage is large and ample. Seating with very good view of the stage from all levels, with the right elevation to not be obstructed by the person in front of you, unless you are unfortunate enough to have a rather tall lad sit in front of you. Acoustics are impeccable. The setting is very grand and truly fits the occasion. Looking forward to the next musical.

Sands Theatre balcony seats for the George Michael concert was just 60 dollars and i had a wonderful view. Contrary to what is thought, not every concert means paying through the nose.
Great audience. And the romantic saunter to the Theatre from the Helix Bridge is great foreplay. So proud to be a Singaporean!

I also found out the Theatre is hosting the musicals  Matilda in Feb  2019 and Phantom in late April to May.

I came here to watch The Lion King when it was out last month. This Theatre is very beautiful and I'd recommend any visitor to watch a theater here (if it is within your budget). The employees will gladly help you to take a picture at the theater poster and there's an organized line for it.

I am here to watch Lion King show. The theatre is very good. The sound system also very good. their lighting is great. Also the service is good. Their arrangement seating is also good. Although its depend to the people who,s watching. if the do know how to watch the show...not make noisy..and sit until block the audience behind
Went for The Lion King musical. Love the surround sound effects! Always go for stall seats for a greater theatrical experience. You never know when the cast will appear somewhere near you 😉

0025ad97272bb114d13af613e357b7a451e.description: Whether a Broadway hit or West End offering, the Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands® brings the best shows under one roof for a world-class experience.
0025ad97272bb114d13af613e357b7a451e.name: Sands Theatre

reviews.text:
Novotel Singapore is located in the heart of Clarke Quay, which is a popular area for tourists to stay. It is very well connected via MRT, Bus and Taxi services, and surrounded by a lot of popular restaurant serving different cuisines. 
The hotel itself is also pretty nice with spacious and clean rooms, courteous and helpful staff and extremely child friendly. The breakfast buffet has a lot to chose from, especially and Indian section to cater to guests from India.  
The hotel gives an overall pleasant feel to the guests.
The location and ambience is good. There is swimming and gym. U can enjoy the locality view if u happen to get the right rooms.

Reasonable hotel for a few days.
Breakfast with large variaty, but food is of average quality only.
Fruit with almost no taste and I ate only once worse waffles. 
Rooms are fine; silent, good in size and we'll equipped.
The next Metro and bus stop is only 150m away.

4-star hotel but overall 3-star level.
Room is not renovated recently.
There were 3 of coin laundry machine and dryers. 
If you stay at premier floor, you can access the premier lounge where enjoy the snack and beverages. However, I recommend to have the breakfast in the restaurant of 7th floor. 
Very good location where you can Clarke Quay by foot.

Great place in Singapore center. Wonderful skyline view from business lounge on 24th floor. Perfect for family King bed suite. Great people, great service. As little minus, slightly worn furniture in a room, but it doesn't change very positive impression.

001e51f0fa6cbf1498baa669e99e876c2c9.body:
Nestled along the banks of the historical Singapore River, Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay offers a blend of history and hip – making it the best hotel in the city.

Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay has a strategic location in the city, between the Central Business District (CBD), Marina Bay and just minutes to the Orchard Road shopping street.

The hotel is adjacent to the vibrant and hottest multicultural nightspot of Singapore, Clarke Quay with over 150 restaurants and bars. It is connected to Liang Court shopping mall, fondly known as Little Japan to the locals.

Sheltered access to the Downtown Line Fort Canning MRT Station allows for easy access to all the major Singapore city spots including the Central Business District, Marina Bay, Chinatown and Little India, as well as direct access to Changi Airport.

Each of the 403 upgraded rooms boasts a magnificent view of the Marina Bay, Singapore River or the lush greenery of Fort Canning Park. Ranging from Standard to Premier Suite, all guest rooms have been carefully designed to blend ergonomics with spacious, modern designs and colourful décor, while maintaining the relaxation and comfort every Novotel hotel is globally known for.

Novotel’s signature all-day dining restaurant, The Square, will certainly fulfil guests’ appetites with superb international and local cuisine. The hotel lounge, Le Bar Rouge is a perfect venue to chat with friends and colleagues while enjoying light drinks and meals.
001e51f0fa6cbf1498baa669e99e876c2c9.amenities: Business Centre;Gym;Swimming Pool;Club Lounge;Free Wi-Fi;Laundry & Dry Cleaning;Baby Cot;Connecting Rooms;Smoke-free Hotel;Baby-sitting Services;
001e51f0fa6cbf1498baa669e99e876c2c9.name: Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay
001e51f0fa6cbf1498baa669e99e876c2c9.description: Hotel accommodation | City Hotel | 4 Star Hotel

reviews.text: Five star hotel in Singapore.. Good to stay for tourism, I really like these food.. Good view from my room and also good service anything in here.. So dont hesitate to booking. Thank you
Very upmarket  hotel. Not sure if it's for the average but traveller. Comfy rooms and swanky hotel foyer.  More suited to Asian travellers.

Good location with helpful and friendly staff. Quiet rooms and well maintained. My only issue was the breakfast buffet which served very little hot 'western' type food which was obvious following previous visit when it had been available.

This is a good hotel with wonderful staff. The location on the river seemed like a good idea but it is too far from metro services and this is my reason for the 3 stars. If you're just there for hanging out in the evening and don't look to sight seeing it is a great hotel for you.

Hotel was nice. However after calling back to get some information about the transaction record, I was transferred around and eventually told to email and got no response. I get better service from hostels.

0017262d985f4714e73b53669b820a62f8c.body: Situated on the banks of the historic Singapore River and within close proximity to Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and the Marina Bayfront, the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel is one of the largest conference accommodation hotels in Singapore. The hotel is fully Wi-Fi equipped, offering lifestyle and business-enabling conveniences to facilitate travellers’ needs. Health and leisure facilities, executive accommodation and business support services are also available for ultimate comfort. With 574 guest rooms and suites, including rooms available for the physically challenged, each guest room is equipped with business-enabling conveniences such as wireless broadband internet access, a selection of cable channels and pay-movies, in-room personal safe, IDD service, hair-dryer, coffee and tea making facilities. Room categories include Superior, Superior Bayview, Deluxe, Deluxe Bayview, Club, Club Deluxe, Executive Suites, Waterfront Suites and La Residenza Serviced Suites for long-staying guests. With the growing demand for non-smoking rooms, the hotel has a total of 22 floors of rooms appointed for non-smoking guests.
0017262d985f4714e73b53669b820a62f8c.amenities: Prayer Facilities;Connecting Rooms;Swimming Pool;Carpark;ATMs Check;Free Wi-Fi;Laundry & Dry Cleaning;Shuttle to Places of Interest;Wheelchair Accessible;Gym;Club Lounge;Business Centre;
0017262d985f4714e73b53669b820a62f8c.description: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel is one of the largest conference accommodation hotels in Singapore.
0017262d985f4714e73b53669b820a62f8c.name: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel

002c38e2a1ea61e4f34893b0a6195084b0b.body: Explore the tropical highlands amidst orchids, pitcher plants and ferns from the cool-moist Tropical Montane region. Be amazed as you encounter the world's tallest indoor waterfall at 30 metres and descend through the surreal mist-filled Cloud Walk and Treetop Walk.
002c38e2a1ea61e4f34893b0a6195084b0b.admissionInfo:
Standard Rate - Two Conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest)
Adult: $28
Child (3-12 years old): $15
002c38e2a1ea61e4f34893b0a6195084b0b.description: Enter the Cloud Forest, a mysterious world veiled in mist. Take in breath-taking mountain views surrounded by diverse vegetation and hidden floral gems. And learn about rare plants and their fast-disappearing environment.
002c38e2a1ea61e4f34893b0a6195084b0b.name: Cloud Forest at Gardens by the Bay

reviews.text: One of my favorite places in Sentosa. The flowrider is one of the best I've used. The instructors are super friendly and really great at teaching you to use it. The bar itself is quite nice. Very good food and drinks.

Very fun as a first timer. How much you learn depends on the instructor you get. My instructor seemed aloof at first but started sharing tips after a few failed attempts. Go early to avoid a packed class, which reduce your number of tries. There were 6 in my class and i did around 7 tries, more than I expected!
Lots of fun. Mentors are good and very attentive. Just prepare to be sore at the end of it especially if you fall often.

It's great fun to ride these artificial waves and there's only a few of them around the world.
The only thing that seriously spoiled the fun were the guys operating the attraction (you couldn't call them 'instructors'): they were pretty uninterested, tired of their job, counting their precious time till their next break, like they wished they were somewhere else. 
Too bad because this attraction was pretty pricey.
Nice beach time. Good music, could be quieter. Order food only if you are extremely hungry.

002646bf65702f04b7192367d0c839a10d7.body: Wave House Sentosa, the most iconic in a global family of Wave House venues, is the place to experience the Californian beach lifestyle with high-adrenaline flowboarding on The Double FlowRider® which is the more gentler of the two waves and 10-foot FlowBarrel® which create the perfect endless barreling wave rides! Chill out to the beat of awesome music as you savor modern Californian– Asian cuisine at the Wave House Sentosa Restaurant + Bar or cool off from the tropical heat at our Beach Bars. All these spread across its idyllic 70,000 square feet tropical beachfront setting at Siloso Beach, Sentosa.

pricing.others: The Double FlowRider: S$35/hr for weekday, S$40/hr for weekend. FlowBarrel: S$30/30 mins for all days.

002646bf65702f04b7192367d0c839a10d7.description: Experience the Californian beach lifestyle with high-adrenaline flowboarding on the world famous Double FlowRider® and 10-foot FlowBarrel® wave rides!
002646bf65702f04b7192367d0c839a10d7.name: Wave House Sentosa

reviews.text: Great resort island with lots of museums, amusement areas and shopping.  Excellent restaurants.  Clean and spacious.  Easy access to beach with water sports activities.  Quick access with tram, bus and private transportation.  Has nice hotels to stay.  Very safe.  Great customer services.  Beautiful landscape with jogging and biking trails.  Lots of shading areas and rest stops.
Excellent!! Amazing!! Once in a lifetime experience. It is a must visit kind of place. We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Kids had so much fun there. They have made it something like heaven on earth!!
Location is perfect. Cleanliness is good. However, staff is not polite as compare to other five star resort. Don't have much veg option.. Overall value for money..

Sentosa hosts almost all the main tourist attraction spots. We had visited adventure cove water park continued with 8pm show of crane dance. Both were amazing. For water park would suggest to bring your towels. To attend crane dance show better be there 10-15 minutes before show timing. It’s a free show loaded with fireworks.

What an amazing place to explore. The huge main plaza not only connects people to the theme parks Adventure Cove and Universal, but has a selection of restaurants and shops. There is also another level below everything of more shops to encounter. There is also an infusion of Americana in this area near Universal and the Hard Rock Hotel.

002ce0a3b07e6f546008bf576e3753a97ab.description: Resorts World Sentosa is home to some of Singapore’s leading attractions: the S.E.A. Aquarium (one of the world’s largest oceanariums), Universal Studios Singapore (Southeast Asia’s first and only Universal Studios theme park), the Maritime Experiential Museum, and the Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark. Other attraction offerings include the Trick Eye Museum, featuring various optical illusion artworks and installations, and the Crane Dance, a pyrotechnic light and water show that is displayed at the Waterfront nightly. Covering an area of 49 hectares, the integrated resort also offers diverse accommodation options across its six hotels, myriad celebrity chef restaurants and dining experiences, varied retail offerings, a casino, a convention centre, and an award-winning spa.
002ce0a3b07e6f546008bf576e3753a97ab.name: Resorts World Sentosa

003b24f2b7122a64649ae9fecb602a408a9.body: Located at Boat Quay, Marina Bay Seafood offers a wide selection of Thai and Indochines seafood cuisine.

reviews.text: Check Trip Advisor for a more comprehensive review on this infamous place. The only reason to eat here if you want to get scammed of your money. Feeling rich and wanna to this taste some lousy food? This is the place to be!
Very expensive. Small portions and watery beer

Expensive place. Not the best food. But view and seating area is good. This place is suitable for tourist who yet to appreciate local cusine. Wont go there again. Customer service can be alot improved. Sprite can cost 7 bucks.
good view but bad food and expensive price. fried squid is oily and soggy. how can u go wrong with such simple food. dont come unless have no choice.

Keep away from this place! We’ve made a big mistake , it is a try ripoff they lure you by telling you Chile crab is $50 per kg, then distract you and offer Alaskan King crab, not making you aware the price increases to $198 per kg. Very expensive not nice food not good service! Don’t waste your time!!!

003b24f2b7122a64649ae9fecb602a408a9.description: Located at Boat Quay, Marina Bay Seafood offers a wide selection of Thai and Indochines seafood cuisine.
003b24f2b7122a64649ae9fecb602a408a9.name: Marina Bay Seafood

reviews.text: A very standard place. Chawanmushi was grainy. All else competent. Good but overpriced. I can see a greedy owner watching chef on CCTV so not too much ikura is dished out

Had a 5 star wonderful experience dinner at one of the top fine dining Japanese restaurant in Singapore. The exquisite foods were skillfully and freshly prepared by the Executive Chef Mr Kenji Nakagawa. One of my top recommendations for Japanese food!

Everything is perfect.Awesome appetizer, Tempura, Sashimi, Sushi, Customer service.
If you come to Singapore, you should definitely visit this restaurant!!
I visited for lunch and had Hiyama beef katsu and steak recommended by chef. It was so nice and I recommend strongly for you if you've never been.
Wide variety of sashimi that are not readily available in sg

005e847648c95bd44a39ee8cc55a7d5005f.body:
Sushi Jiro is home to the finest Japanese cuisine in Singapore, serving seasonal fish directly imported from Japan twice a week. Backed by 40 years of experience, Chef Kenji-San pampers your taste buds with fresh seasonal sashimi, nigiri sushi, grilled and deep fried dishes, paired perfectly with a variety of Sake and Shochu.

MUST TRY: Expect indulgent signatures such as Chef's sushi and sashimi courses from S$100++,Chef’s Okamase Courses start from S$180++
005e847648c95bd44a39ee8cc55a7d5005f.description: Sushi Jiro is home to the finest Japanese cuisine in Singapore, serving seasonal fish directly imported from Japan twice a week. Backed by 40 years of experience, Chef Kenji-San pampers your taste buds with fresh seasonal sashimi, nigiri sushi, grilled and deep fried dishes, paired perfectly with a variety of Sake and Shochu. MUST TRY: Expect indulgent signatures such as Chef's sushi and sashimi courses from S$100++,Chef’s Okamase Courses start from S$180++
005e847648c95bd44a39ee8cc55a7d5005f.name: Sushi Jiro (Marina Mandarin)

001dc1a19ee42b946dbb9741a08b3ae1f93.body: Exuding elegant charm with accents of Singapore’s rich heritage, the 403 spacious guestrooms and suites feature plush beddings, custom furnishings and well-appointed amenities, including a daily selection of print and digital newspapers and a smartphone in every guestroom with unlimited 4G data to ensure seamless connectivity throughout the stay, along with complimentary local and international calls to 20 overseas destinations.
001dc1a19ee42b946dbb9741a08b3ae1f93.amenities: Connecting Rooms;Baby-sitting Services;ATMs Check;Smoke-free Hotel;Laundry & Dry Cleaning;Club Lounge;Free Wi-Fi;Gym;Wheelchair Accessible;Swimming Pool;Carpark;
001dc1a19ee42b946dbb9741a08b3ae1f93.name: InterContinental® Singapore
001dc1a19ee42b946dbb9741a08b3ae1f93.description: A luxury landmark set in a historic precinct, InterContinental Singapore is deeply rooted in the arts and cultural districts of Bugis and Bras Basah. Within close proximity to the Bugis Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) train station, the 403-guestroom hotel showcases elegantly-appointed meeting spaces that can accommodate up to 500 guests.

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my expectations in every department. The highlight is the food served in the restaurants. Every single dish I ordered had something extra in terms of flavor that surprised me.  I can't wait to come back. Staff is so professional and courteous.

Quite a mixed review to be honest. Planned a surprise proposal for my girlfriend. VIP services upgraded me to a skyline suite, experienced fantastic service.. however this was dampened by their poor handling of parking coupons. Asked for parking coupons for my guests but was outrightly rejected with a 1 coupon per room policy reason. Had to explain to my guests which put me in a spot. Was told by concierge that Pan Pacific guests faced this issue before, but they didn't seemed to have structured a solution quickly to solve it. Eventually I reimbursed my guests myself to save the waiting time. Looks like paying for a suite doesn't get you a guaranteed 5 star service. FYI, I have never faced this at other local hotels before.
Outstanding hotel in the heart of the business district. Elegant finishing of the rooms and interior. Incredible restaurants and very friendly and dedicated staff

We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. The room was spacious, with nice bay view at the balcony. There are many restaurants in the hotel, food is fine. Hotel is connected to many shopping centers. Concierge is very professional and friendly. We had a good time!

One of favorites in Singapore. Started staying here from 2005 and stayed couple of times. Rooms are large and spacious, clean and staffs are simply amazing. I remember about one fine morning when we were late to have breakfast and it was closed, however, the staffs arranged some good breakfast for us even after hours. Will never forget this service of PanPac Singapore.

0012b7f2beba3ca41369d53a8fadf28fb03.body:
Located in the heart of Marina Bay, a stay at Pan Pacific Singapore is your assurance of exceptional service and five-star luxury accommodation. Only a 20-minute drive from Changi Airport, the hotel is connected via sky-bridge to three major shopping malls, Suntec Singapore Convention & Exhibition, and within walking distance of both City Hall and Promenade MRT stations.

Indulge in a perfect blend of comfort and elegance in our 790 contemporary rooms and suites, backed by the state-of-the-art in-room technology, wireless Internet connectivity and sweeping panoramas of Marina Bay or the city skyline. Savour epicurean delights at our award-winning restaurants and bars or unwind and rejuvenate at our refreshed swimming pool.

Pan Pacific Singapore has earned consistent votes as one of the World’s Best Business Hotels by Travel + Leisure’s Best Awards and clinched the prestigious Four Stars award in Forbes Travel Guide 2019, an affirmation of its dedication to delivering quality hospitality experiences through unsurpassed service, top-notch facilities and enhanced amenities.
0012b7f2beba3ca41369d53a8fadf28fb03.amenities: Business Centre,Baby Cot,Free Wi-Fi,Spa,Wheelchair Accessible,Swimming Pool,Laundry & Dry Cleaning,Gym,Children's Pool,Carpark,Club Lounge,Connecting Rooms
0012b7f2beba3ca41369d53a8fadf28fb03.description: Enjoy world-class service standards, gastronomic dining experiences and luxurious accommodation at Pan Pacific Singapore to create memorable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.
0012b7f2beba3ca41369d53a8fadf28fb03.name: Pan Pacific Singapore

00288c30bf6f7244c46a9f90d5e871c9b93.body: Singapore’s oldest Hindu temple was rebuilt as Sri Mariamman Temple, dedicated to goddess Mariamman, who is believed to heal the sick. During the colonial period, it was a first refuge for new immigrants, a dispute mediation venue and where marriage ceremonies were held for Hindus. Travellers who visit in October-November may get to observe the Theemithi, which is the main festival observed here. Visitors can marvel at the temple’s six-tiered gopuram, or grand tower entrance. The visual treat continues with the temple’s elaborate interiors, featuring shrines with statues of different deities.

reviews.text: This is a place that has such history and the architecture is so detailed. The sculptures decorating the temple are fantastic. Also you have the opportunity to go in there. For women, you have to have your head covered when you go in. It has a calming feeling when you sit in there.

Definitely a great sensory experience. The temple has great design and decor. The sounds are fantastic with vocal and instrumental offerings to the deities. The unique smells that one can only experience in a ritual setting and the tastes of the offerings that the devotees make available. All in all, a great way to experience the hindu culture of devotion.
Visiting Mariamman temple is thrilling in a foreign land. Well maintained. Architecture is fine with masonry details. People of all religion visit it.

it was really a great experience seeing the evening prayers ceremony. We have also been offered food (prasad) which was tasty and they welcomed us like they (who sponsored the prayers) know us. It was amazing to see the south Indian traditions. 

Even i have been in Indian from the last 30 years but never got a chance to see such a ceremony inside a temple.

Very accessible. Beautiful artwork. Amazing snaps to be taken.

 Just a point for tourists to note, please remove your footwear at the entrance of the temple before entering. Also, kindly note as it is a holy place, please be respectful and dress appropriately (not recommended to be dressed shorts/tube tops) at the venue.

00288c30bf6f7244c46a9f90d5e871c9b93.description: Singapore’s oldest Hindu temple was once a refuge for new immigrants, a dispute mediation venue and where marriage ceremonies were held for Hindus.
00288c30bf6f7244c46a9f90d5e871c9b93.name: Sri Mariamman Temple

002404027a5c89240478eb318fe1f240298.body: Chinatown Street Market re-creates the street hawking of yesteryear with 140 stalls offering a wide array of Singapore-centric and themed souvenirs, apparels, arts and crafts. Walking down the bustling downtown of Pagoda Street, Sago Street, Smith Street, and Trengganu Street transports you to an old era of Singapore. Scour through these streets with stall offerings in which reflects Chinatown’s heritage tells little known stories of Chinatown’s rich and vibrant culture. Experience a glimpse of Chinese culture unique to Singapore at Chinatown today.

reviews.text: Full of people, houses, stores, fast food restaurants, at places - interesting architecture; Chinese lanterns all over. Well worth a visit to soak up in Far Eastern culture, though in Singapore everything is a little bit different ... When we visited, it was the Chinese New  Year, so a lot of decorations were spread all over.

Not the usual Chinatown around the world.  It's not as dirty since its Singapore.  Food market is now closed but the street is still packed with varieties of option.  Shop around if you're looking for souvenirs.  Price difference between shops are common. Overall it's a nice to spend 3 hours there.

Good place for buying souvenir and having NON VEG Chinese food and other foods. Mainly Beef, pork, duck, various sea foods, etc. Buddha Tooth Relic is a good Buddhist temple in China town. Many shops are wholesale kind.

So many food options! And outdoor covered seating which is nice. Take a walk around and find something that suits your tastes! It can get a little busy but just don't worry and you'll be eating in no time. Lots of gift shops with junk as well.
Focus on the tourist is noticeable from every corner but even with that it's still unique and worth visiting. Try to go to hawker center there after sunset. There's little pub to discover.

002404027a5c89240478eb318fe1f240298.description: A vibrant one stop destination for interesting and diverse shopping, dining and entertainment.
002404027a5c89240478eb318fe1f240298.name: Chinatown Street Market

0020b152e847d8d40df96f7a1094fcde100.body:
Our multiple award-winning Cultural Cooking Class programme is designed to help you dive deep into the fascinating side of Singapore’s food heritage and culture in an informal and fun atmosphere. You will discover how our multi-racial society blended together in a perfect harmony through food. Thereafter, you will have lots of hands-on fun learning how to cook up three authentic Singaporean dishes under the guidance of friendly instructors during this 3-hour cooking class.

Don't worry, we have specially designed the class format such that even if you have never stepped into the kitchen before, you will be able to learn at your own pace and have fun!

reviews.text: This class was recommend by my niece. It was run & enjoyable & a great learning experience. If you are an experienced or novice cook you will enjoy & get something out of this class. i loved learning about the history behind the heritage foods. Being a former Singaporean I am familiar with Singapore food & the dishes we made were really delicious & authentic. Helen is an engaging teacher. I am looking forward to returning for another lass & highly recommend it to others seeking a fun culinary adventure in Singapore.

I've never been to a cooking class while I'm love to cooking.
The course was fabulous not only in cooking but in discovering the history of the country... 
Teresa our extraordinary teacher, she told us, and explained how to cook as my grandmother or my mother would have done with the same passion. 
I will definitely take part in the next course, to talk and gain the experience that the teachers of FOOD PLAYGROUND have !!!!!
Is too interesting and fun. A big thank you to everyone !!

Great to get back to Food Playground after doing a great class here 4 yrs ago. Love that you get a hands on cooking experience while learning about the food culture and history of Peranakan food in Singapore. Mary was a terrific tutor sharing her own family experience and upbringing. 
Daniel (owner) is the champion of this meaningful social cause, which is to help more stay-at-home mothers return to the workforce by providing them with meaningful flexible employment opportunities so they can stay connected to society, earn some income for their family and regain their self-confidence. 
Highly recommended as the first thing to do during any stay in the lion city!

One of the best parts of our Singapore vacation! Intimate cooking class where we learned about the history of Singapore dishes while making our own. Great whether you are a beginner or a professional.

Wonderful experience and a tremendous way to spend a morning in Singapore'. Teresa was our instructor and not only did she teach us cooking techniques but also the history of the dishes we made. She had an excellent way of presenting her subject and adding humorous personal tidbits made for a very easy and tasty learning experience. I would recommend this @session to anyone who is visiting Singapore and wants to understand the culture and food. You won't be disappointed.

0020b152e847d8d40df96f7a1094fcde100.description: Our signature Cultural Cooking Classes let you dive deep into the fascinating side of Singapore’s food heritage and culture, and cook up local family recipes like Laksa, Hainanese Chicken Rice and Satay using fresh local ingredients
0020b152e847d8d40df96f7a1094fcde100.name: Food Playground

reviews.text: Don't go by its size or location. The service isn't not to your expectations, beyond to what you think! Great service and staff. Fantastic experience I have. Just drop and feel like you are at your another home. I have ever seen such homely food in any abroad place so far. You can't compare either breakfast, lunch or dinner with such combination of food items. My rating is not five 🌟 but 5 🌟+++++.☝.
Great place to stay at Little India. Rooms are extraordinarily beautiful. Provides basic amenities like toiletries, slippers, electric kettle, mini fridge etc. Superb breakfast buffet.

The rooms were rather small, but was clean. The staff were helpful and it was close to the Metro and local eateries. Perfect place if you like Indian or Pakistani food; decent neighborhood as well. Recommend for couples, travelers on a budget or in transit.

Perfect location for Indian tourists. The staff was very polite and the humility was exceptional. The hotel was very helpful and understanding to personal needs. Very happy with the overall experience.
Too good & clean ..... Staff is very good.... 😍food is  testy.. Love it..

001065916304e5c428b932535445533b58a.body: AQUEEN Heritage Hotel—Little India is situated at the heart of Little India, giving guests the perfect spot from which they can explore the cultural precinct. Its contemporary rooms are furnished with Quintessential by Aqueen™ mattresses, the first of its kind in the hospitality industry. Handicap-accessible rooms are also available. Visitors who wish to shop around the area can head to the Little India Arcade or the iconic 24-hour shopping mall, Mustafa Centre. The hotel is also close by to mosques such as the Masjid Abdul Gafoor and Sultan Mosque, making it convenient for Muslim travellers who wish to pray. For those who want to go further, Little India MRT Station is just a four-minute walk away from the hotel and takes guests directly to destinations such as Chinatown and Orchard Road.
001065916304e5c428b932535445533b58a.amenities: Smoke-free Hotel,Free Wi-Fi,Wheelchair Accessible,Laundry & Dry Cleaning
001065916304e5c428b932535445533b58a.name: AQUEEN Heritage Hotel - Little India
001065916304e5c428b932535445533b58a.description: With a cultural precinct at its doorstep, this hotel offers the perfect stay for culture lovers and history buffs.

reviews.text: Very good hotel. 10-20 minutes from the airport. Very quick service for check in and checkout. Not good for Asian or South Asian people in respect to food in breakfast. Rooms are a little small but good if you are roaming around the city in the day. Markets and shopping center are in walking distance.

Booked a superior double for 2, the room was really quite small which is expected. Glad it’s quite clean though. They do charge a fee of 2-3% for credit card payment, which I think they shouldn’t have. Most hotels in Singapore just absorbed it as operation cost instead of transferring the merchant fees to customers. What they charging may be higher than what the bank’s charging them though.
Overall service was not bad. Front office staff is helpful.

Very good staff at the front office. Helped us to make a few calls to the tour guide and gave directions to so many places. Rooms are clean and nice but tiny. Our one was with a nice view towards Victoria street. Waiting distance to many good shopping locations. very easy to catch a bus
Breakfast was horrible as we were eating the same thing for 4 days

Great location and great price.  The front desk at the hotel is constantly busy.  Uber is not available in Singapore, however they have this app called Grab.  Works exactly the same.  Use that to get to the hotel instead of taking a taxi.  The rooms are fairly small but very clean.  The staffs are all wonderful to deal with.  The gym is small as well with about 6 machines/equipment all together.

Considering it is advertised as a 4 star hotel the standard is poor.  Rooms are small and lacking in storage. Best advise is use for a short stay only. Breakfast is best described as either one of the four letter words one starting with s and ending with a t or starting with c and ending in p. There is supposedly a Western restaurant  but can't get an English breakfast No bacon...

0018389f5824b154e1a80433eee5765f913.body: With 1,500 rooms spread across 11 room types, Hotel Boss caters to every traveller’s needs. The 19-storey hotel boasts a business centre, outdoor pool, shopping alley and eateries such as halal restaurant Jubilicious. It is next to Malabar Muslim Jama’ath Mosque, and Sultan Mosque is a seven-minute walk away, convenient for Muslim travellers who wish to pray at a mosque. Art galleries, high-end shopping outlets and quirky local boutiques are nearby. Travellers can walk to Kampong Glam and Little India to learn more about Singapore’s rich heritage.
0018389f5824b154e1a80433eee5765f913.amenities: Free Wi-Fi, Gym, Serves Halal Food, Smoke-Free Hotel, Swimming Pool, Wheelchair Accessible, Airport Shuttle, Gift Shop, Laundry & Dry Cleaning
0018389f5824b154e1a80433eee5765f913.name: Hotel Boss
0018389f5824b154e1a80433eee5765f913.description: Guests will appreciate the business centre, outdoor pool, shopping alley, eateries such as halal restaurant Jubilicious, and the close proximity to Singapore’s cultural precincts.

reviews.text: Nice place to stay. Strategically located. But not exactly worth the price paid for. Rooms are on the smaller side. My room had minor traffic noise despite sealed windows. Price defines it as luxurious, but facilities could ve been better for price paid.
Great hotel in the heart of Singapore near all amenities and eating places. Can be noisy down stairs but rooms of very good standard. Breakfast very poor

Perfect reasonable hotel for stay.
Food is also delicious, they do have Indian food on the menu.
It is located perfectly for tourists.

Pleasant and proactive staff. Clean, tidy and well kept public areas. Near to several Hawker centres. Across the road to an Aladdin's cave of all manner of clothing, accessories and outfits from the Indian subcontinent. A short walking distance to a MRT stop.

Nice hotel but bedrooms fairly small with nowhere to sit except on the bed.  Close to Little India area of Singapore.  In room fridge was so iced up I doubt it would have kept anything cool, however when we mentioned it at reception it was sorted within a few hours.

001caf1ad9d39ac456a8104ec591df8b166.body:
Conveniently located just minutes away from the bright lights of Little India and the culture-rich Straits Chinese enclave of Bugis, Village Hotel Albert Court effortlessly straddles the best of both worlds. While a walk around the compound will uncover traditional Indian and Peranakan carvings and motifs on the walls, a peek into any room will reveal modern facilities catered to both business and leisure travellers.

Stepping out, guests will find themselves within walking distance of both historical and modern attractions such as the Goddess of Mercy Temple and the Singapore Art Museum.

If you’re looking to live like a local, Village Hotel Albert Court will definitely put you right at the centre of it all.
001caf1ad9d39ac456a8104ec591df8b166.name: Village Hotel Albert Court
001caf1ad9d39ac456a8104ec591df8b166.description: Live like a local at Village Hotel Albert Court.

reviews.text: Decent dim sum. A lot of the nicer food were mixed with truffle. Service here was a bit slow as they seem short staffed for a hotel Chinese restaurant. It is expensive to eat here so would expect better service. There are some discounts available such as for amex love dining but other than that at full price it's not really worth

A restaurant that has good Lou Hei - not so sweet. The roasted chicken was nice and tender. The other dishes are so so. The attention of the service staff is not too bad. Generally a good place to go since it’s not as crowded as other restaurant.
Nice environment, very good and delicious Dim Sum.  They also served Peking Duck.
Had to book 2 days in advance, extremely slow service, nothing fantastic about the food, not worth the time and price. Definitely not returning.

The menu has changed and dim sum is no longer a standalone menu but rather has been incorporated into the main menu. There are now only about 10 items in the dim sum menu and prices have increased tremendously as well. 

The food still taste good but given the price increase, it does certainly leave a bit of a bitter taste to many customers. Having said that if you have AMEX Platinum Card or better, you can get great discounts of up to 50% off (excluding GST and service charge)

0050d7fd61d4f4944ecb1eb1967d20a6940.body:
Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant offers some of the best Chinese cuisines in Singapore, serving a tantalising collection of dishes that are suitable for family gathering and large groups. From Sweet and Sour Iberico Pork to Live Crab its extensive menu is reflective of the restaurant’s efforts to cater to every palate.

This restaurant is located in Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel along Orchard Road. Savour the culinary masterpieces of renowned Chinese Executive Chef Lau that have garnered a faithful following since 1995. Slightly crisp and flavourful, the famous Peking Duck is matched perfectly when served with authentic Chinese crepe. Wan Hao is also known for serving up good authentic dim sum.

MUST TRY: Indulge in their mouth-watering dishes such as Deep-Fried Prawn, Salted Egg Yolk Sauce, Steamed Shrimp Dumpling, Baked Egg Tart, Chilled Duck Wing, Spicy Passion Fruit Sauce, Roast Pork Belly, Hot and Sour Soup, Assorted Seafood, Shredded Beancurd.

For their drinks, they offer flower tea, and premium Chinese tea.
0050d7fd61d4f4944ecb1eb1967d20a6940.description: Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant offers some of the best Chinese cuisines in Singapore, serving a tantalising collection of dishes that are suitable for family gathering and large groups. From Sweet and Sour Iberico Pork to Live Crab its extensive menu is reflective of the restaurant’s efforts to cater to every palate. This restaurant is located in Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel along Orchard Road. Savour the culinary masterpieces of renowned Chinese Executive Chef Lau that have garnered a faithful following since 1995. Slightly crisp and flavourful, the famous Peking Duck is matched perfectly when served with authentic Chinese crepe. Wan Hao is also known for serving up good authentic dim sum. MUST TRY: Indulge in their mouth-watering dishes such as Deep-Fried Prawn, Salted Egg Yolk Sauce, Steamed Shrimp Dumpling, Baked Egg Tart, Chilled Duck Wing, Spicy Passion Fruit Sauce, Roast Pork Belly, Hot and Sour Soup, Assorted Seafood, Shredded Beancurd. For their drinks, they offer flower tea, and premium Chinese tea.
0050d7fd61d4f4944ecb1eb1967d20a6940.name: Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant

002bf152b29fbf147d39e5510ffb355607b.body:
Experience Faber Peak Singapore and Sentosa with Cable Car Sky Network

Get onboard the Cable Car Sky Network, a fun way to fly from Singapore’s only hilltop destination, Faber Peak Singapore, to over 20 attractions in Sentosa! Soar high above for priceless views of the exciting island, golden beaches and beautiful greenery. Catch this unique joyride on the Mount Faber Line and the Sentosa Line.
002bf152b29fbf147d39e5510ffb355607b.amenities: Carpark,Free Wi-Fi,Shuttle to Places of Interest,Wheelchair Accessible

reviews.text: Unfortunately the cable car is too hot. I asked the staff before the doors of the cable car closed if it would cool down. They said yes the fan is on. Well it didn't. I used my hand fan but that wasn't enough. When I reached the Sentosa stop I went to the ticket counter and asked for a refund for the return. I was told that I couldn't receive a refund because, I rode the cable car. Of course I wouldn't have ridden it if the staff had said the temperature would NOT cool down. I don't like to post non-positive reviews but, as a traveler this is information I would have found important before I had made my decision to take the Singapore Cable Car.

Get round trip tickets for value for money ! That way, you can explore the island on foot and hop on the cable car when the feet starts to ache. The souvenir shops are awesome..the gifts sold are thoughtful and cater to all ages, from a foldable walking cane to plush toys for the young ones! If only there was a commentary in the cable car, it would be even better!

It was an unique thrilling experience of riding by a cable car. We bought round tickets which helped us to explore many stations on ground including Sentosa island. Sentosa Island has many transport modes of reaching from the Mainland. 

There are many attractions at each of the stations including restaurants and tourists’ facilities. Beautiful picturesque surroundings and one can take lot of photos for remembrance. We thoroughly enjoyed the cable car ride.

Very nice experience. A must visit for tourists. One of the ways to enter Sentosa island. Make sure you cover all the stations and morning and evening times. Do visit Faber peak as cable car is the fastest and easiest way to go there. It runs till 9:30 in night so plan accordingly.

Very friendly team. I have been there twice and the experience is next to none. Plenty of staffs and ask them as many questions as you want and they will assist you with anything. 
Supports available for disabled tourists. 
Public transport access available which is under the shopping mall. 
If you are planing to visit Sentosa island then you must experience this.

002bf152b29fbf147d39e5510ffb355607b.admissionInfo:
Cable Car Sky Pass (Mount Faber Line + Sentosa Line): $35.00 Adult $25.00 Child
Cable Car - Mount Faber Line (Into Sentosa): $33.00 Adult $22.00 Child
Cable Car - Sentosa Line Line (Within Sentosa): $15.00 Adult $10.00 Child
Child aged 4 -12 years old.
002bf152b29fbf147d39e5510ffb355607b.origin: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.
002bf152b29fbf147d39e5510ffb355607b.description: Fly on the Mount Faber Line and Sentosa Line that makes up the Singapore Cable Car Sky Network
002bf152b29fbf147d39e5510ffb355607b.source: MOUNT FABER LEISURE GROUP PTE. LTD.
002bf152b29fbf147d39e5510ffb355607b.name: Singapore Cable Car

null.body:
Tucked away in the serene neighbourhood and set amidst lush greenery of Changi Village, Saltwater offers a wide variety in its buffet spread. Taking the centre stage of Saltwater is none other than the live barbeque station*, our Grill Master standing by and preparing gourmet meats and fresh seafood a la minute. Featuring a wide selection of all-you-can-eat Meat Skewers, Chargrilled Chicken, Beef Ribs, King Prawns, Scallops, seafood, and many more – this spread is bound to captivate the hearts of all carnivores! Indulge in a premium selection of meat cuts of Tomahawk Steaks, Wagyu, and Whole Lamb Leg on rotation from day to day. Also on the spread are our award-winning Nonya Laksa, Oxtail stew, Cereal Prawns, Mutton Biryani, Wok fried Mee Siam, DIY Rojak, and signature Durian Desserts.

*On Friday to Sunday Dinners only


MUST TRIES: Nonya Laksa, BBQ Seafood & Satay, Durian Pengat Shooters, DIY Rojak, Seafood on Ice

null.body:
Overview:

Sessions is a 3-in-1 dining destination in Hard Rock Hotel Singapore. Combining a relaxed café serving sweet treats, a restaurant dishing up hearty crabs, seafood and local hot wok favourites, plus an interactive studio with a fully equipped kitchen for individuals or groups to try their hands at cooking under the guidance of our chefs, Sessions is a multi-concept dining destination where you can share good food and fun with your favourite people.

Chef Bio:

Kelvin Lim

To consistently prepare scrumptious crabs, seafood dishes and tantalizing local hot wok require skills masterfully honed in the kitchen. None does it more perfectly and deliciously than Chef Kelvin Lim who has more than 30 years of experience under his belt.

He began his career as a humble 2nd cutter at Goodwood Park Hotel back in 1982 and steadily rose through the ranks in the kitchens of other esteemed hotels and country clubs in Singapore. His career highlights include introducing the Lobster Laksa during his time at Chatterbox Coffeehouse (Meritus Mandarin) – where the dish quickly became one of the best-sellers in the famous eatery.

reviews.text: It's halal restaurant, not a lot of variety but taste not bad.
Quality of food is fresh and good! Thoroughly enjoyed the snow crabs and the other mains!
Came a few times for their lunch buffet. This time round for a festive buffet lunch. One of the better halal lunch buffet around!
Delicious spread & cozy place for family gathering!😗
Loved it. It really was a great place to have a team lunch. We were all happy!!

null.body:
Tucked away in the serene neighbourhood and set amidst the lush greenery of Changi Village, Saltwater welcomes all, from the business traveller to families and holiday-makers. Guests can tuck in to a Sumptuous Buffet with Asian and Local Singaporean Food Galore in the spacious indoor area, or dine alfresco, overlooking Changi Golf Club.

Our live barbeque station available on Friday to Sunday (dinner only) includes a wide selection of all-you-can-eat meat and seafood grilled a la minute by our chefs!

In line with Saltwater’s aim to extend its reach to the Muslim community, it has been certified Halal by The Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (MUIS).

Taking the center stage of Saltwater is none other than the live barbeque station*, our Grill Master standing by and preparing gourmet meats and fresh seafood a la minute. Featuring a wide selection of all-you-can-eat Meat Skewers, Chargrilled Chicken, Beef Ribs, King Prawns, Scallops, seafood, and many more – this spread is bound to captivate the hearts of all carnivores! Indulge in a premium selection of meat cuts of Tomahawk Steaks, Wagyu, and Whole Lamb Leg on rotation from day to day.

Also on the spread are our award-winning Nonya Laksa, Oxtail stew, Cereal Prawns, Mutton Briyani, Wokfried Mee Siam, DIY Rojak, and signature Durian Desserts.

*On Fridays to Sunday Dinner only.
null.description: Sumptuous Buffet with Asian and Local Singaporean Food Galore in the spacious indoor area, or dine alfresco, overlooking Changi Golf Club
null.name: Saltwater - Halal Certified Hotel Buffet with Live Barbecue station

reviews.text: Super! Have a walk around here. There’s plenty of food, drinks, cafe and a very good crowd. Love it.
Nice place to chill along Singapore landmark. Many nice restaurants and good scenery. It's a good place to watch laser show of Marina Bay Sands at night.

Great restaurant options with a view of the marina bay sands, have been to the Pelican & Overeasy Restaurant/ Bars here.  All the places have a great outdoor and a cool indoor seating, so choose depending on the time of day and the time of year.

Cozy shopping mall with a sea view and a stone's throw away from Merlion Park and the Jubilee Bridge - great places for tourists to take photographs of Marina Bay Sands and the sea. The shopping mall also has cafes like Starbucks and restaurants such as Little Sheep Hot Pot
Very very good place for a dinner and walk around the Bay Area after.

0025485fc425c0a40bdad6356062209061a.body: On the lobby level of the Fullerton Hotel is the Fullerton Heritage Gallery, which displays decade-old photographs, maps, stamps and philatelic materials that showcase the precinct’s rich history. The precinct is walking distance to Merlion Park and is also a popular spot to watch the Marina Bay fireworks display on occasions like National Day and New Year’s Eve. On the guided Fullerton Monument Tour, visitors will discover the rich history of the Fullerton Building, where Singapore’s General Post Office was once located.
0025485fc425c0a40bdad6356062209061a.description: The Fullerton Heritage District showcases the precinct’s rich history and is also a popular spot to watch the Marina Bay fireworks display on occasions like National Day and New Year’s Eve.
0025485fc425c0a40bdad6356062209061a.name: The Fullerton Heritage Singapore

reviews.text: One place not to miss in Singapore. Relatively inexpensive, we went to the future exhibition only, however there was also a minimalist one on too. It was amazing, there were interactive kinetic digital exhibitions where people could interact with the projected images. You could also draw pictures, scan them in and they would be generated on the wall. Great for grown up travellers and also those with kids. Check out the light installation too!

Good place which displays art in way that you could have never thought before. It has different exhibits throughout the year, you can check the schedule before going. Friendly staff with easy and efficient ticketing options. Plus they have a cafe and a beautiful lily pond around. Must go.

It is one of the must go places in Singapore. This particular exhibit: the Future World is best for children. They have 2 interactive exhibit that the kids would surely love. The most breathtaking exhibit for me is the Crystal Galaxy, it really is a must see. It is like you're taken to another dimension.

We went for FUTURE WORLD - WHERE ART MEETS SCIENCE.

5 stars for children and 3 stars for adults. I am awed by the presentation, the level of advanced smart technology and how interactive the setting was. The price was a little steep but it was worth it.

The place however is more like a child’s world. For an adult, it is like a scratch of curiosity. Nonetheless, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR A FAMILY OUTING.

One of the best touristic attraction in Singapore.  It's at Marina bay and close to many other amazing attractions. Its impressive architecture is itself a big attraction. Inside there are many interesting exhibition to all ages. Enjoy!

002c106bdb317f3468fbaebc013b826378b.description: Art, science, culture and technology intersect at the world’s first ArtScience Museum™, a lotus-shaped building located within the integrated resort of Marina Bay Sands®. Major international touring exhibitions have passed through, thanks to collaborations with the likes of the Natural History Museum of London, Japanese art collective teamLab, and jewellery brand Van Cleef & Arpels.
002c106bdb317f3468fbaebc013b826378b.name: ArtScience Museum™

002ab3a2ce25bd8425897dbbd8466ffadff.body: Measuring between 25 and 50 metres tall, Gardens by the Bay's Supertrees are designed with large canopies that provide shade in the day and come alive with an exhilarating display of lights and sounds at night. Stand in awe amidst these iconic giants, or stroll along the 22-metre-high OCBC Skyway and enjoy panoramic vistas of the Gardens and the Marina Bay skyline.
002ab3a2ce25bd8425897dbbd8466ffadff.admissionInfo:
Standard Rate
Adult: $8
Child (3-12 years old): $5
002ab3a2ce25bd8425897dbbd8466ffadff.description: Sitting 22 metres above ground, the OCBC Skyway was constructed to give visitors the unique sensation of floating above the ground.
002ab3a2ce25bd8425897dbbd8466ffadff.name: OCBC Skyway, Gardens by the Bay

002a0699802f8fb4ab78008312b49e26e6c.body:
Situated in the heart of the Singapore Civic District, National Gallery Singapore oversees the largest public collection of modern art in Southeast Asia. Housed in two beautifully restored national monuments - City Hall and former Supreme Court - are impeccably curated exhibitions that reveal the cultural legacy and art histories of Southeast Asia. 

Come visit the Gallery today and discover the rich art and cultural heritage of Singapore and Southeast Asia through stunning modern art masterpieces.

reviews.text: A nice place to spend approximately half a day. Very beautiful exhibits and the building is huge. It's easy to miss out on some beautiful art if you can't figure out the navigation inside. I went on a Saturday when the entry happened to be free and it wasn't very crowded. You can enjoy the exhibits and pop into one of their many restaurants. I was surprised to find good food for a pretty decent amount in one of the cafes.

Husband works next to this place at the Supreme Courts so this place is my coffee fix or waiting area till he is off work. Sit around, or walk the galleries. Very very relaxing and good fun. It used to be the old Supreme Courts and wow, they have really preserved this place really well. Well done.

Much more than a Museum this place is an experience. Superb exhibits. Architecturally stunning. A masterpiece of modern engendering and design. You will need a day at least and you still won't see everything. Fantastic Place! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐👍
Beautiful place and art. I love having my family come along for a walk whenever there are some exhibition coming to town. Great! Walk around and do sit down for coffee. Most enjoyable.

A sanctuary for art-lovers. Very impressive. The building is beautiful as well as huge—it may take a day or so to explore it completely. I recently visited the minimalism exhibition, which certainly did not disappoint. If you happen to be in Singapore, this place is a must-visit!

002a0699802f8fb4ab78008312b49e26e6c.admissionInfo:
General Admission: $20,
General Admission (Singaporean & PR): Free, 
Special Exhibitions: $25, 
All Access Pass: $30
002a0699802f8fb4ab78008312b49e26e6c.description: Situated in the heart of the Singapore Civic District, National Gallery Singapore oversees the largest public collection of modern art in Southeast Asia.
002a0699802f8fb4ab78008312b49e26e6c.name: National Gallery Singapore

00226968356f24c430a934a585413ccd16d.body: National Gallery Singapore, in the heart of the Civic District is a state-of-the-art facility with an impressive collection of local & Southeast Asian artists. Two national monuments - the City Hall and former Supreme Court - were remodelled to create this stunning gallery. It is the biggest visual arts venue in Singapore housing the world's largest public collection of modern Southeast Asian art from the 19th century to the present. Its esteemed Southeast Asian catalogue carries names such as Indonesian Romantic painter Raden Saleh and Fernando Amorsolo from the Philippines.

It's easy to miss out on some beautiful art if you can't figure out the navigation inside. I went on a Saturday when the entry happened to be free and it wasn't very crowded. pricing.others: Adult: S$20, Child: S$15, Senior Citizen: S$15

00226968356f24c430a934a585413ccd16d.description: Two national monuments - the City Hall and former Supreme Court - were remodelled to create this splendid gallery, which offers an impressive collection of local and Southeast Asian artworks.
00226968356f24c430a934a585413ccd16d.name: National Gallery Singapore

0028a78cb67b5f94940b48001fddec94155.body: Spectra – A Light and Water Show

reviews.text:
Spectra how much I love YOU!!!!

WOW, what a breathtaking and mindblowing kind of show.

This is definitely any type of water show, the music, the colors, the lights, and everything else made this a wonderful show.

We went twice and if it wasn't I was sick, we would have gone 4 times.

I loved it so much, it made me happy and I got such a positive vibe out if it.

This show is located on the water and you can watch it from the main entrance of the Shops at Marina Bay Sands.

A free laser light show in front of The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands. It was the first time I saw one of this laser shows in my life and I must say it`s absolutely amazing. If you are travelling to Singapore this is a must do, the show just outside of The Shoppes Mall. I will definitely watch the show again on my next visit.

A very nice laser show. They spray water into the air and project videos in that water. You can hear music and all in all it is a very nice show. Make sure you come early as there are many people who want to see that and if you are stuck in the crowd you do not see much. The show takes about 15 minutes and they do it twice per evening.

I was in owe while watching the light show. A spectacular night to remember.   I think I almost cried just by watching this water light dances. This will just melt your heart. A night you should not miss and did I mentioned?? it's FREE.

An amazing sound and light show in the water. About 20 to 30 minutes, but you are like hypnotized, so beautiful forms of water, lighted and additionally figures are projected into it. One of the absolute musts when in Singapore. Held in the late evening. Go good 30 minutes before, in order to take a front seat. Free.

0028a78cb67b5f94940b48001fddec94155.description: Gyroscopic arches, lava and mist effects and a 12-metre-high glass prism are only a slice of what to expect at Spectra, Marina Bay Sands’® light and water show that’s framed against the city skyline. The show takes place nightly on the Event Plaza along the promenade, featuring state-of-the-art lighting technology and colourful projections on the water foundations.
0028a78cb67b5f94940b48001fddec94155.name: Spectra – A Light and Water Show

002990557421caf4a2d9abebaae930ba151.body: Enter a world of perpetual spring! Replicating the cool and dry Mediterranean climate, Flower Dome showcases exotic plants from five continents which are displayed in nine different Gardens. Wander amongst thousand-year-old olive trees and unusual Baobabs as you take in sights of the Flower Field Display.
002990557421caf4a2d9abebaae930ba151.admissionInfo:
Standard Rate - Two Conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest)
Adult: $28
Child (3-12 years old): $15
002990557421caf4a2d9abebaae930ba151.description: Step into the Flower Dome and stand in awe of nature. Spectacular and innovative, it is the largest glass greenhouse in the world as listed in the 2015 Guinness World Records! Be amazed by changing display of flowers and plants from the Mediterranean and semi-arid regions.
002990557421caf4a2d9abebaae930ba151.name: Flower Dome at Gardens by the Bay

003018dda1dfee74eb68d27682a3f9f6765.body:
Tucked away in the serene neighbourhood and set amidst lush greenery of Changi Village, Saltwater offers a wide variety in its buffet spread. Taking the centre stage of Saltwater is none other than the live barbeque station*, our Grill Master standing by and preparing gourmet meats and fresh seafood a la minute. Featuring a wide selection of all-you-can-eat Meat Skewers, Chargrilled Chicken, Beef Ribs, King Prawns, Scallops, seafood, and many more – this spread is bound to captivate the hearts of all carnivores! Indulge in a premium selection of meat cuts of Tomahawk Steaks, Wagyu, and Whole Lamb Leg on rotation from day to day. Also on the spread are our award-winning Nonya Laksa, Oxtail stew, Cereal Prawns, Mutton Biryani, Wok fried Mee Siam, DIY Rojak, and signature Durian Desserts.

*On Friday to Sunday Dinners only


MUST TRIES: Nonya Laksa, BBQ Seafood & Satay, Durian Pengat Shooters, DIY Rojak, Seafood on Ice
